newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czechs say Clinton NATO target matches plans, hopes.
newsitem.headline: Czechs say Clinton NATO target matches plans, hopes.

text.p: The Czech ambassador to the United States said on Wednesday President Bill Clinton's call for NATO to recruit former Soviet bloc countries by 1999 was in line with Prague's plans and hopes.
"It is perfectly consistent with our expectations and our planning. This is the timeline we were thinking about and hoping for," said ambassador Michael Zantovsky.
"It's still very encouraging to hear this from the president during these very important days," he told Reuters during a visit to Prague where he running in Senate elections next month.
Speaking in Detroit on Tuesday, Clinton did not name any countries directly in his call for an eastward expansion of NATO by the time the Western alliance celebrates its 50th anniversary in 1999.
The Czech Republic, Poland and Hungary are tipped as frontrunners for early membership. NATO is due to decide on which countries should join when next spring.
President Vaclav Havel has yet to react to Clinton's speech and no one was available for comment at the Foreign Ministry.
